title: Porto vs Nice Bet Builder Tips - 7/1 Europa League Special, Analysis & Predictions
text:
Looking to take a giant leap towards booking a Europa League knockout stage ticket on Thursday evening, Porto will welcome Nice to the Estadio do Dragao.
Enjoying what has become an extended flurry on either side of November’s international break, the Dragons have their sights firmly set on mounting a genuine European charge this season and they will be smelling the chance to lay down a real marker here.
At the heart of what has quickly become a major crisis, Nice have rightfully come under a tremendous amount of scrutiny over the past month and Thursday’s guests should be bracing themselves for another stern examination on foreign soil.
Ahead of what could prove to be a pivotal Europa League showdown on Thursday evening, we have taken a look at some of the most attractive Porto vs Nice bet builder tips.
A golden opportunity for Porto
Only collecting a single point from either of their two previous Europa League appearances, Porto have plenty of pressure on their shoulders when they return to the Estadio do Dragao in midweek.
Nevertheless, still regarded as a standout contender to claim a knockout stage ticket this season, Francesco Farioli’s men have continued to shine on either side of November’s international break.
Extending on their Taco de Portugal adventure over the weekend as they marked their return from November’s fortnight interval with a 3-0 victory against Sintrense, Porto have won four of their previous five appearances across all fronts.
Likewise, the Portuguese icons have suffered just a pair of defeats from any of their first 17 appearances across all competitions and they are rightfully pencilled in as a standout contender here.
Getting their Europa League adventure underway with consecutive victories against Salzburg and Red Star, Porto have also remarkably tasted just a single defeat in front of their owns supporters since the endow January.
Bet Builder Tip: Porto win @ 4/9 with 1xBet
Nice’s public nightmare
Completely blown away over the weekend as they marked their respective return from November’s international break with a 5-1 drumming at home against domestic foes Marseille, Nice find themselves at the heart of a public nightmare.
Heading into the fortnight interval with a 2-1 loss away at Metz, Thursday’s guests have lost each of their previous four appearances across all formats by an aggregate score of 11-3.
Coming under even more scrutiny earlier in the month as they slumped to a 3-1 defeat against German outfit Freiburg, the pressure on Franck Haise’s shoulders is now at a boiling point.
Getting their European campaign underway with a 2-1 loss against Italian icons Roma on September 24th, Les Aiglons have lost all of their first four Europa League showdowns by an aggregate score of 9-4.
Facing what look set toe be another stern examination when they travel over to Portugal on Thursday evening, it should also be highlighted that Nice have failed to record a single clean sheet away from the Allianz Riviera since the middle of January.
Bet Builder Tip: Antoine Mendy to be shown a card @ 11/4 with BetUS
Sainz could play a leading role
Finishing as the Norwich’s top goalscorer last season after registering 18 Championship strikes, it was reported over the summer that Borja Sainz was attracting plenty of interest from across Europe’s elite.
However, putting pen to paper on a five-year deal with the Portuguese giants back in July, the 24-year-old has certainly made an immediate impact at the Estadio do Dragao.
Once again finding the net while on Raca de Portugal duties over the weekend, Sainz has now found got on the scoresheet in three of his previous four appearances across all competitions on either side of November’s fortnight interval.
Opening his Europa League account away at Dutch outfit Utrecht earlier in the month, the former Spanish youth international finds his stock at a red-hot high and will be looking to make another statement here.
Meeting a leaky Nice defence who have registered just a single clean sheet on their travels so far this calendar year, the one-time Alaves youngster has also bagged back-to-back strikes on home soil.
